meta.title: Weave Symbol Overrides
meta.author: Kohl (The Weaver)
meta.purpose: Contextual adaptation of Weave symbols for theological or cultural frameworks.
notes: Overrides are optional; Weave OS will fall back to default glyphs if none are specified.
Each context key (e.g. 'christian', 'buddhist') can contain partial symbol maps.
Intended for use with the Codex localization and theological translation layers.

christian._comment: Aligns with themes of mercy, resurrection, and divine light.

jewish._comment: Reflects the Torah, menorah, and covenantal remembrance.

muslim._comment: Centers on mercy, prayer, and divine illumination (An-Nur).

buddhist._comment: Emphasizes the Dharma wheel, lotus, and liberation from attachment.

hindu._comment: Represents unity of Atman and Brahman, with cyclical time and divine light.

taoist._comment: Echoes harmony, flow, and balance between yin and yang.

secular_humanist._comment: Centers on shared humanity, reason, and ethical empathy without metaphysics.
